Package frechetDistance

Class AnyDiscreteFrechet

java.lang.Object
frechetDistance.AnyDiscreteFrechet
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterruptionMeasure<Polygon>, Measure<Polygon>
Direct Known Subclasses:
DiscreteFrechet, IntegralDiscreteFrechet
public abstract class AnyDiscreteFrechet
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterruptionMeasure<Polygon>
A discrete measurement of the distance (dissimilarity) between two Polygons.
Author:
Anton Ballmaier
See Also:
Polygon

  • Method Details

    • distanceCapped

      public double distanceCapped​(Polygon p, Polygon q, double max)
      Approximates the discrete fréchet distance variant. If the distance is greater than the given maximum, the approximation is interrupted and Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY is returned instead.
      Specified by:
      distanceCapped in interface Measure<Polygon>
      Parameters:
      p - the first polygon to be compared
      q - the second polygon to be compared
      max - the maximum distance of the given polygons for which the distance calculation should be performed
      Returns:
      the approximated fréchet distance of the given polygons
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given polygons have different dimensionality

    • accumulate

      protected abstract double accumulate​(double a, double b)
      Used to accumulate the cost of reaching the pair (i,j) where i is a vertex of the polygon p and j is a vertex of the polygon q. The cost of this pair is
      accumulate(c(k,l), δ(i,j)),
      where
      • c(k,l) is the minimal cost of a preceding pair of vertices (i.e. one of (i-1,j), (i,j-1), (i-1, j-1)) and
      • δ(i,j) is the distance between the vertices i and j.

      The implementation of this function must be monotone in both arguments, meaning the following must always be true: 

       accumulate(a,b) ≥ a
 accumulate(a,b) ≥ b
      Using Math.max as the implementation for accumulate will therefore yield the typical discrete fréchet distance.
      Parameters:
      a - the minimal cost of any preceding pair of vertices
      b - the distance of two vertices
      Returns:
      the accumulated cost of a pair of vertices
